page.title: 01Whalley & District,Lancs.(1)
page.content: The{Domesday Book}of 1086 noted of our area that in the{Blacheburn} (Blackburn) Hundred "The church of St. Mary had 2 carrucates of land in{ {Wallei}(Whalley) quit from every due." The village of{Whalley}and its surrounding district form the centre of our Domesday Project for 1986. Whalley is a picturesque village to be found in the{Ribble Valley,}in North-east Lancashire.It stands on the banks of the{River Calder}some 6 miles from{Blackburn,}7 from{Burnley } and 5 from{Clitheroe.} It is sheltered to the south by { {Whalley Nab}and to the north by the heights of{Pendle Hill. { }Very much a dormitory village for the surrounding large towns, Whalley has become a popular tourist centre with{St.Mary's Church}and the{Abbey}as historical focal points.
